text: as you can see the trains are still
running commuters are coming into the
city center but this no doubt the
protests are having a big impact have a
look at this this should normally be a
busy road teeming with traffic but today
it resembles something of a cross
between a political demonstration and a
festival over here they're selling
sandwiches these are going for a little
less than a dollar each and further away
they're selling hats and flags and
banners tourists are mingling with the
crowds and this is a very good-natured
if not somewhat nosy protest which is
why I'm having to hold the microphone so
closely but having look further down
this street here you can see a large
crowd rallying outside the national
police headquarters and this is a
dispute now in which the loyalty of
almost every institution and body of
state is being called into question and
there is always lurking the threat of
real violence that it may be instigated
deliberately engineered in order to
force a military intervention to remove
Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra from
power if that happens of course then
there's the risk of an equal and
opposite reaction from her supporters
who will claim perhaps with some
justification that these people have
achieved through mass protest what they
cannot achieve by democratic mandate
this may look like a carnival but it is
a fight with a heart and soul of
Thailand's democracy and the window for
a peaceful resolution is narrowing
